sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Monday received some continued tepid commentary from analysts at Jefferies & Co.
The firm reiterated its "Hold" rating on HD and lifted its price target from $46 to $48.
That new target still suggests a 9.5% downside to the stock's Friday closing price of $53.06, however.

A Jefferies analyst commented, "We are maintaining our Hold ratings on the shares of HD and LOW ahead of 2Q earnings but still prefer Home Depot to Lowe's despite the 22% P/E valuation gap that exists.
We believe the market fairly reflects the fact that HD continues to outperform on the sales and EBIT lines and the greater likelihood of downside risk at Lowe's."
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.19% dividend yield, based on Friday's closing stock price of $53.06.
The stock has technical support in the $47-$50 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $54-$57 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
